newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian high-altitude plane to study ozone layer.
newsitem.headline: Russian high-altitude plane to study ozone layer.

text.p: Russia's high-altitude M-55 aircraft will take part in an international experiment to collect more information about the ozone layer in the North Pole region, a senior official said on Tuesday.

Deputy chief designer of the Myasitchev aircraft bureau Stanislav Smirnov told Reuters that the M-55 would fly from Zukovsky air base near Moscow to Italy next week to be equipped with European scientific equipments.
"In January of next year the aircraft will begin flights in the polar zone stretching from above Great Britain to the Urals to study changes in the ozone layer," Smirnov said.
He said the 23-tonne M-55 jet, which has capacity to fly 5,000 km at a 21.5 km altitude for up 6.5 hours, would be operated by a Russian crew.
"Scientists hope to improve data on the ozone layer above Northern Europe," he said, adding that the plane was able to operate in difficult weather conditions.
Smirnov said that in 1997 the aircraft would also be used for study of the ozone layer in Antarctica.
